lexUnit.name: set off.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (support verb set) begin a journey.

sentence.text: Without hesitation , she set off in pursuit , unable to think beyond the fact that he would be lost , not even considering that if she was dismissed he was no longer her responsibility .
The policeman had been genuinely pleased by the invitation , and the two had set off for the river .
Next morning Sophie set off for Seabourne , and , after looking in the pet shop window , she went inside and strolled around .
Bol√≠n set off for Rome on 19 July .
Maggie was not cheerful as they set off for Granada .
FOLLOWING two years of fund raising and six to eight weeks hard net practice we set off for the Far East on December 16 , 1991 for a combined cricket and hockey tour .
He stood up abruptly , and without explanation or offer of assistance , set off on the descent to the factory floor .
` Watch out ! " you yelled as I set off on holiday .
Rich men in gowns , dresses and Roman robes set off on foot to north , south , east and west .
Disconsolately , we got back into the rickshaws and set off to the next address .
He changed his mind , and set off in another right direction , but this offered only more hills .
The major new documentary series of the year was Granada 's widely acclaimed ` Disappearing World " in which Brian Moser set off in search of native tribes in the remotest parts of the world .
The gang told the woman they were heading towards Widnes , and they then set off in a blue car .
BREATHLESS PC Les Pounder was always going to come off second best when he set off in pursuit of a pub fight suspect .
` My Cat " , it began , ` was in agony due to being hung upside down from our bedroom window by my brother , when I set off in the luxurious coach provided for us .
Fiona and I set off from Fulham in our car at about 9 a.m .
She was aware that he stood watching her as she set off towards the exit .
By the time we had driven to Port Eynon , the wind had really picked up but not easily deterred , we abandoned the car and set off towards the cliffs .
Soon after breakfast we set off into the jungle .
Leopold dawdled before setting off for home .
The Welshman had set off home in a cold fury .
They set off at half past five in Charlotte 's car .
The promotion-winning team set off a short time ago from the County Ground to tour the town in an open-topped bus , before a civic reception given by Thamesdown Council .
He set off at a brisk pace for the lower station of the funicolare by Piazza Amedeo .
